- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-MKDOCS-1729735
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-MKDOCS-2438396
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-PYGMENTS-1086606
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-PYGMENTS-1088505
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-PYTHON-TORNADO-40792

     :type autosave: boolean

+    :type encoding: string

comment.body:
```suggestion
    :param encoding: Set the encoding of the settings file. Default is ‘utf8’.
```

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,51 +19,43 @@ def _mkdir(path):
 class ReadSettings:
     """
     Main ReadSettings class.
-
     :type path: string
     :param path: The settings file to use.
-
     :type ext: string
     :param ext: Override the file type.
-
     :type autosave: boolean
     :param autosave: Set the autosave behaviour. Default is True.
-
     :raises ValueError: Invalid file type provided!
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.json")
     >>> data["foo"] = "Hello World"
     >>> data["foo"]
     'Hello World'
     >>> del data["foo"]
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t0.invalid")
     Traceback (most recent call last):
       ...
     ValueError: Invalid file type provided!
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t6.json")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.yml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.toml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
     """
 
-    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True):
+    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True, encoding=None):
comment.body: What if you did: `encoding=sys.getdefaultencoding()`?

issue.title: Update compatibility for web globals on Node.js #18035

labels.name: data:browsers :earth_africa:
labels.description: Data about browsers (versions, release dates, etc). This data is used for validation.

issue.body:
<!-- 👀 Thanks for opening a PR! Read comments like this one to get your PR merged faster. -->

#### Summary

Node.js 18 and 19 have exposed new web features as globals.

https://nodejs.org/api/globals.html

comment.body: Node.js 18 enters Active Maintenance in about 24 hours, so I updated the versions so that the CI passes.

issue.title: Update compatibility for web globals on Node.js #18035

labels.name: data:browsers :earth_africa:
labels.description: Data about browsers (versions, release dates, etc). This data is used for validation.

issue.body:
<!-- 👀 Thanks for opening a PR! Read comments like this one to get your PR merged faster. -->

#### Summary

Node.js 18 and 19 have exposed new web features as globals.

https://nodejs.org/api/globals.html

comment.body:
CI is failing with:

> nodejs has multiple current releases (18.0.0, 19.0.0), which is not allowed.

This is inaccurate, see https://github.com/nodejs/Release/blob/0573a2f6e65c2cafa73f0d0a20ce1637d40e3285/README.md#release-schedule

issue.title: Support `ReadableStream`
issue.body: While Node.js Readable streams have `Readable#from`, the same doesn't exist for [web Readable streams](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ReadableStream). Perhaps this module could be pivoted to using web streams instead?

pull_request.title: [Snyk] Security upgrade github-pages from 198 to 198
pull_request.body:
This PR was automatically created by Snyk using the credentials of a real user.


Snyk has created this PR to fix one or more vulnerable packages in the `rubygems` dependencies of this project.

#### Changes included in this PR - Changes to the following files to upgrade the vulnerable dependencies to a fixed version: - Gemfile.lock #### Vulnerabilities that will be fixed ##### With an upgrade: Severity | Priority Score (*) | Issue | Breaking Change | Exploit Maturity :-------------------------:|-------------------------|:-------------------------|:-------------------------|:------------------------- ![high severity](https://res.cloudinary.com/snyk/image/upload/w_20,h_20/v1561977819/icon/h.png "high severity") | **661/1000**
**Why?** Recently disclosed, Has a fix available, CVSS 7.5 | NULL Pointer Dereference
[SNYK-RUBY-NOKOGIRI-3052880](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-RUBY-NOKOGIRI-3052880) | No | No Known Exploit (*) Note that the real score may have changed since the PR was raised. Check the changes in this PR to ensure they won't cause issues with your project. ------------ **Note:** *You are seeing this because you or someone else with access to this repository has authorized Snyk to open fix PRs.* For more information: 🧐 [View latest project report](https://app.snyk.io/org/richienb/project/4a0c1bb6-8c12-414e-a895-40c37f93ed3f?utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral&page=fix-pr) 🛠 [Adjust project settings](https://app.snyk.io/org/richienb/project/4a0c1bb6-8c12-414e-a895-40c37f93ed3f?utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral&page=fix-pr/settings) 📚 [Read more about Snyk's upgrade and patch logic](https://support.snyk.io/hc/en-us/articles/360003891078-Snyk-patches-to-fix-vulnerabilities) [//]: # (snyk:metadata:{"prId":"dc1be26a-6b14-4a90-8682-8077c1d9828f","prPublicId":"dc1be26a-6b14-4a90-8682-8077c1d9828f","dependencies":[{"name":"github-pages","from":"198","to":"198"}],"packageManager":"rubygems","projectPublicId":"4a0c1bb6-8c12-414e-a895-40c37f93ed3f","projectUrl":"https://app.snyk.io/org/richienb/project/4a0c1bb6-8c12-414e-a895-40c37f93ed3f?utm_source=github&utm_medium=referral&page=fix-pr","type":"auto","patch":[],"vulns":["SNYK-RUBY-NOKOGIRI-3052880"],"upgrade":["SNYK-RUBY-NOKOGIRI-3052880"],"isBreakingChange":false,"env":"prod","prType":"fix","templateVariants":["updated-fix-title","priorityScore"],"priorityScoreList":[661]}) --- **Learn how to fix vulnerabilities with free interactive lessons:** 🦉 [Learn about vulnerability in an interactive lesson of Snyk Learn.](https://learn.snyk.io/?loc=fix-pr)

     >>> data["foo"] = "Hello World"
     >>> data["foo"]
     'Hello World'
     >>> del data["foo"]
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t0.invalid")
     Traceback (most recent call last):
       ...
     ValueError: Invalid file type provided!
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t6.json")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.yml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.toml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
     """
 
-    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True):
+    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True, encoding=None):
comment.body: What if you did: `encoding=sys.getdefaultencoding()`?

issue.title: Update compatibility for web globals on Node.js #18035

labels.name: data:browsers :earth_africa:
labels.description: Data about browsers (versions, release dates, etc). This data is used for validation.

issue.body:
<!-- 👀 Thanks for opening a PR! Read comments like this one to get your PR merged faster. -->

#### Summary

Node.js 18 and 19 have exposed new web features as globals.

https://nodejs.org/api/globals.html

comment.body:
CI is failing with:

> nodejs has multiple current releases (18.0.0, 19.0.0), which is not allowed.

This is inaccurate, see https://github.com/nodejs/Release/blob/0573a2f6e65c2cafa73f0d0a20ce1637d40e3285/README.md#release-schedule

issue.title: Support `ReadableStream`
issue.body: While Node.js Readable streams have `Readable#from`, the same doesn't exist for [web Readable streams](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ReadableStream). Perhaps this module could be pivoted to using web streams instead?

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -19,51 +19,43 @@ def _mkdir(path):
 class ReadSettings:
     """
     Main ReadSettings class.
-
     :type path: string
     :param path: The settings file to use.
-
     :type ext: string
     :param ext: Override the file type.
-
     :type autosave: boolean
     :param autosave: Set the autosave behaviour. Default is True.
-
     :raises ValueError: Invalid file type provided!
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.json")
     >>> data["foo"] = "Hello World"
     >>> data["foo"]
     'Hello World'
     >>> del data["foo"]
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t0.invalid")
     Traceback (most recent call last):
       ...
     ValueError: Invalid file type provided!
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t6.json")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.yml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
-
     >>> data = ReadSettings(".rs-tmp/t1.toml")
     >>> data["helloWorld"] = "newValue"
     """
 
-    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True):
+    def __init__(self, path, ext=None, autosave=True, encoding=None):
comment.body: What if you did: `encoding=sys.getdefaultencoding()`?

issue.title: Update compatibility for web globals on Node.js #18035

labels.name: data:browsers :earth_africa:
labels.description: Data about browsers (versions, release dates, etc). This data is used for validation.

issue.body:

comment.body:
CI is failing with:

> nodejs has multiple current releases (18.0.0, 19.0.0), which is not allowed.

This is inaccurate, see https://github.com/nodejs/Release/blob/0573a2f6e65c2cafa73f0d0a20ce1637d40e3285/README.md#release-schedule

issue.title: Support `ReadableStream`
issue.body: While Node.js Readable streams have `Readable#from`, the same doesn't exist for [web Readable streams](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/ReadableStream). Perhaps this module could be pivoted to using web streams instead?
